title: A Lock-Free Vector

Stay Curious About Your Tools‚Ää
description: I lurk here a lot, though I do not post often, and one thing I appreciate about this crowd is a consistent desire to understand one‚Äôs tools. (Sometimes to a degree that can be snobby at people who aren‚Äôt the same kinds of nerds as us; but that is a normal human foible about passions.) And I think that‚Äôs at least one small part of why I have been motivated lately to dig in deeper into my chosen operating system: to get to know it well, to make it more my own. So: thank you all!
description_plain: I lurk here a lot, though I do not post often, and one thing I appreciate about this crowd is a *consistent* desire to understand one‚Äôs tools. (Sometimes to a degree that can be snobby at people who *aren‚Äôt* the same kinds of nerds as us; but that is a normal human foible about passions.) And I think that‚Äôs at least one small part of why I have been motivated lately to dig in deeper into my chosen operating system: to get to know it well, to make it more my own. So: thank you all!

submitter_user.about: I'm Chris Krycho‚Äîa follower of Christ, a husband, and a dad. I'm a [software engineer](https://v5.chriskrycho.com/cv/) by trade; a theologian by vocation; and a writer, runner, podcaster, and composer by hobby. Outside [my own site](https://v5.chriskrycho.com), I also cohost and produce [Winning Slowly](https://www.winningslowly.org), a podcast about technology, religion, ethics and art; and occasionally write for [Mere Orthodoxy](https://mereorthodoxy.com).

submitter_user.about: Hi, I'm [Peter Bhat Harkins](https://malaprop.org), a programmer and entrepreneur from Chicago. From June 2014 to winter of 2015 I typically posted a dozen stories per day to [help](https://lobste.rs/s/9pm09z/what_is_on_topic_what_is_not/comments/nie0yn#c_nie0yn) the site reach a critical mass of regular visitors. In October 2017 I became the site administrator after the site creator @jcs stepped down. * Please don‚Äôt message me for an invitation if we're complete strangers; check the user list for someone you know or ask [in chat](https://lobste.rs/chat). * Submit a [`meta`](https://lobste.rs/t/meta) post for feature requests (including new tags) to let the community discuss. Bug reports and "is this a bug?" should go to [the issue tracker](https://github.com/lobsters/lobsters/issues). * [Message me](https://lobste.rs/messages?to=pushcx) for administrative and moderator things. I don't see everything and I gotta sleep sometime. * E-mail my first name @malaprop.org regarding site security or if you can't log in to message me. If I've posted or commented about something here or in the chat room, I'd almost certainly love to talk more about it.

From June 2014 to winter of 2015 I typically posted a dozen stories per day to [help](https://lobste.rs/s/9pm09z/what_is_on_topic_what_is_not/comments/nie0yn#c_nie0yn) the site reach a critical mass of regular visitors. In October 2017 I became the site administrator after the site creator @jcs stepped down. * Please don‚Äôt message me for an invitation if we're complete strangers; check the user list for someone you know or ask [in chat](https://lobste.rs/chat). * Submit a [`meta`](https://lobste.rs/t/meta) post for feature requests (including new tags) to let the community discuss. Bug reports and "is this a bug?" should go to [the issue tracker](https://github.com/lobsters/lobsters/issues). * [Message me](https://lobste.rs/messages?to=pushcx) for administrative and moderator things. I don't see everything and I gotta sleep sometime. * E-mail my first name @malaprop.org regarding site security or if you can't log in to message me. title: IntelligentPad: component-based drag-and-drop software creator
description: IntelligentPad (1987) was a drag-and-drop software creator based on the concept of reusable components. Pads could be reused on other pads. There was no programming language so software could be created by anybody, including those without programming experience.
description_plain: IntelligentPad (1987) was a drag-and-drop software creator based on the concept of reusable components. Pads could be reused on other pads. There was no programming language so software could be created by anybody, including those without programming experience.
